title: So PBE zed ult nerf was reverted.
body:
It is now official; zed has been 100% buffed by the PBE changes to shuriken.

-35 base damage at rank five, 75% damage for second shuriken instead of 50%.

> [{quoted}](name=UrZedM8,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EHj66bhV,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-25T06:19:46.650+0000)
>
> Eh me maining Zed doesn't make me biased, just means I have a little more knowledge on the subject than most.  I can admit that Zed was broken in the past few patches, but currently he is just eh, the only thing that is kind of dumb atm is how qss no longer works on his ult, but I think the changes on the pbe will allow good players to play against Zed better.  These days I just read Zed qq threads for the comedic value.  That is always a funny argument though, maining a champion automatically makes all of your comments biased and untrue.  I guess that's just the logic on the boards though.

I'm an AD champion, what's the counterplay to a Zed ult... because it used to be QSS/MS, but now ...  ?

Most assassins have some type of counter.  Kat, for instance, hard CC the ult, she's worthless, 

Saw a Zed out-trade a 330 Armor Irelia the other day, they were the same level, had roughly the same farm/gold... but can't really counter that ult.  Sure, as a mage there is still Zhonyas, albeit on a very long cooldown now comparatively, but what's the counter as an AD champ to Zed?

>330 Armor Irelia

Just to be blunt, that sounds like a terrible build. o.0

You really will never need more than 250 armor.  And for Irelia if she doesn't have {{item:3078}} {{item:3153}} then something is really wrong.

BotRK is situational at best on Irelia. I'd personally say it's bad most of the time.

It's generally best to just go Tri>Sterak's>tank and ignore other offensive items, except Maw if they're AP heavy, Maw is still broken.

If I was against a 4 AD team as Irelia I'd build something like {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3110}} , this is a pretty good build in that situation and it probably is at least 330 armour.

Hm, 230 from items, 89 base, so really just needing 11 from runes/masteries.
Still, I can't help but feel you'd be better off with some form of lifesteal.

Also past 250 armor, the only build I can think of for Zed to really out class Irelia, would have to be his carry build.  That's a lot less common after his AS nerf.

Buying lifesteal on Irelia is kinda pointless, you heal a lot from abilities anyway and lifesteal works off of your AD and AS, while you probably get some decent AS your AD is not as good so you just don't benefit much from it. If you want more healling then SV is the best item available, it's just better to multiply what you already have than to try to add more flat numbers.

You also need to remember that resists are disproportionately strong on healers. Every 100 armour gives you an extra 26 effective HP every time you AA. You generally want more armour and less HP to become tanky on Irelia, although when you get 4K HP as a by-product of building armour it certainly doesn't hurt.

You generally don't need a 3rd damage item on Irelia, the only time it would be useful is against a mid power duellist like Renekton where you just need a tiny bit more damage than normal to deal with him and you actually can realistically duel him unlike someone like Jax. In these cases your best option is Maw if they have magic damage or Youmuu's if they don't. Youmuu's just gives you a lot more than a BotRK.

And yes, an Irelia with the build I suggested or anything even remotely close should beat a Zed unless he's building something like {{item:3153}} {{item:3036}} specifically to try an duel you. Even if he did that the fight would probably still be in Irelia's favour.

Hm, 130-260, yeah I'd say you'd need something heavy to out heal her Hiten Style active.  In that case I'd probably consider something like {{item:3124}} as a possible alternative to  {{item:3742}}.  A great deal of synergy with her Hiten Style, lots of dueling power and with her stun it would be easy to stack, at which point Zed would be forced to disengage or get shredded most likely.

You never build Rageblade on Irelia, it just doesn't work. If you do the maths you find that BotRK gives you slightly more DPS than a fully stacked Rageblade. Rageblade is a trap item on almost everyone, it's good on Kog and Kayle and OK on Jax, past that though you should never buy it on anyone.

Against 4 AD teams, which is the scenario I suggested that build for it is optimal to just stack armour. Sure you could build a Youmuu's and be a better duelist, but do you need to? Can the Zed realistically outduel the 5 item 250 armour Irelia? If the answer is no then the best thing you can do is try to be tankier for fights.
If you want armor, Thornmails would be better for dueling purposes; lifesteal really really helps.

Lifesteal's multiplicative, unless you already have a high AA only DPS it's not really worth it. Its other use, sustaining off of waves is pretty redundant on Irelia as well.

Thornmail isn't that good right now. I'd generally prefer FH. Stat wise it's a far better item and it's aura is incredibly powerful for both dueling and fighting. I also think you need the extra 1K or so extra HP to go with Sterak's to make it's passive a bit stronger. I'd be reluctant to replace either of them because of that.

The lifesteal is nice, but it's the %hp and attack speed that helps, especially vs tanks. The active can help too. 

I just never felt that Frozen Heart had much of an impact on characters I built, except pre-rework Tar and Ryze.

>I just never felt that Frozen Heart had much of an impact on characters I built, except pre-rework Tar and Ryze.

You don't feel it, but it does. The FH passive is a pretty huge reduction in ADC DPS.
He makes more meaningful decisions than like any assassin.

Zed Decision Tree: 

Are they alive? 
No: Brag to your team about how you are carrying them. 
Yes: Press R to fix that.

And this doesnt define talon/rengar/akali/fizz/every assassin not named khazix? Zed's burst can easily be avoided without needing an item to negate his ult, you just have to git gud. I say this as someone who only plays mages mid zzzz

Almost everyone you listed has one way into the enemy team - they have to at least fully commit to their attempts - and if they fail they have to walk home - exposed to enemy attacks. Zed can open on someone with W->R from the fog of war without any counterplay, kill them, then press W again to pretty much recall to base. 

How can Zed's burst be "easily avoided" - it's point and click - you press R... That's it. 
Counterplay: Uh... go to the Zed's house and steal his R key?
Counter-counterplay: live far enough away that the match is over before your midlaner has had time to go steal Zed's R key. 

Not a single one of the assassins you listed can get in as quickly, from as far away, as Zed's W->R. 
Of the assassins you listed, only Rengar has a comparable Time To Kill to Zed's R application. 
Of the assassins you listed, none of them can escape like Zed (press W or R again).

Zed being able to escape is all ins is why he's able to be healthy, back in the day assassins had to suck because they were so binary. They either sucked or rolled the whole game in unstoppable fashion.

Zed's burst is not point and click, his R does damage based off of landing autos and skillshots, and gives a huge telegraph allowing you or an ally to position appropriately or prepare crowd control. Compare to talon who instantly teleports to you and blows you up with instant front loaded burst. Akali who blinks to you 3 times and basically stat checks you to death... Zed's damage is very avoidable since it's so loaded into his shuriken, and its even easier if you have hard cc that can easily catch him when he ults you.

First off, Zed is not healthy. It's why he's permabanned.  

"Back in the day" is still today, for almost every other assassin. It's not an outdated mechanic, it's how almost everyone else in the archetype (assassin) works. 

R_ is _point and click. 

How do you 'position appropriately' during the half-second R cast, that you're calling a telegraph? 
CC works on everyone - that's not unique to Zed - that's not a balancing countermeasure - you can CC talon when he dives too. 
Talon's time to kill is _longer_ than Zed's. His burst is front-loaded thanks to Q+E, but it's not enough to kill alone - Zed can buy Duskblade, press W->R->W, and then walk away laughing - because that person is already dead. 

Akali gets wrecked in lane phase until 6 - up until then she's the shittiest laner in the game. Zed has the best assassin poke, ranged wave clear, no mana, and the fastest lane push. Zed can kill anyone in lane at level 2, Akali tries to just XP soak and not feed until 6. Can she burst with full R stacks post-6? Definitely - that's why she's an Assassin - but if she messes up she gets to walk home - Zed presses W or R to escape any retaliation. 

"Zed's damage is very avoidable since it's so loaded into his shuriken" - Shurikens are like the easiest projectiles in the game to land - and they're almost impossible to dodge when you're point-blank on your target with W and/or R. 
It's not hard to land a projectile wider than a Morgana Q, that travels over twice as fast, when you throw three of them at once, from point-blank range, that penetrates all targets, has a short cooldown, and virtually no real cost (since energy is an infinite resource). 

Look at it objectively, without your Zed bias. Is Zed 'the most broken thing ever'? Obviously not. Is he broken? Absolutely. That's why he's permabanned right now. 

The entire league community isn't collectively banning Zed because we dislike his laugh. We're doing it because he's not healthy for the game. Assassins need a weakness - whether that's Akali's shitty lane phase, or Diana's 'no escape' commitment, or Rengar's fear of pink wards - you aren't supposed to be amazing at everything all the time: Zed is.

Other assassins do this exact same  thing.  Rengar, Diana, Talon, Akali, Katarina, Fizz, etc.  I get that assassins are frustrating (and Zed is definitely too strong right now) but that description is literally the point of an assassin.

the difference being they do not have free escapes. they have to outplay (stealth khazix) or **kill first** for the jump reset. 
talons escape is tied in to his ult. fizz is tied in with half of his damage  and or zhonyas CD, katarina needs a reset and a ward/team mate, diana has no escape, akali no escape, rengar no escape. 

so when they go in, they're available to take a beating, zed not so much.

zed has 2 built in escapes. which can be justified, but in zeds current case, it just isn't, it makes him gross in relation to everyone else.

I'm confused.  The part I quoted stated that the squishy is alone.  If that squishy is alone, then how are escapes relevant in that situation?  If anything, it means his W is used to keep him within threat range of the champion he is attempting to kill.

Regardless, I don't believe that Zed's escape potential is the source of his current problems/frustrations.  In my opinion, it's his ability to assassinate without necessitating his Q.  Honestly, a Zed can kill somebody purely with his E and auto-attacks if Death Mark is available.  The only times I find Zed needs to land his Q is before he has his core build, or if he needs to duel somebody tankier than himself.

Zed's bullying is also quite strong and them nerfing the base damage on it but making multiple Shurikens do more damage is a good design choice.

I believe the reduction of the damage Death Mark did on it's lonesome was also a step in the right direction (and it is nonsensical that they cut the nerf).

if you're concern is damage, zed has the least loaded all at once damage, but the highest potential between autos, bonus damage, and scaling (so much so that it is absurd, and using poke is quite damaging against enemies) zed rarely needs his full kit to kill someone, usually **his ultimate ability is routinely used to gap close onto the squishy, not as a direct or necessary source of damage** 

((what champion doesn't need their ultimate ability to pick someone off?)) (((but he is still technically using it to gap close, so sure, fine he does have to use his ultimate, but just think of how much damage zed has)))

the question always remains what is ok for zed to have and what isn't. what zed has is poke, ez handed to him farming, wave clear, escapes, gap closers, (mobility) in lane bulk, huge build path variety and counterbuild access while maintaining kill potential, (sustain pending build path) and of course damage. 

so whats zed lacking in? team fighting, damage variety (hes all ad), utility (just a slow). now you tell me is this justified?

I think a lot of what Zed does is justifiable for his champion.  His mobility, dueling, and laning seem proper to me.  The way he does it isn't quite as fair though.  Having a single Q do less damage, but landing more than one Q do heavy damage, should be the reward for Zed and ties his harass into a long early CD (his W).  This currently is not the case.

Additionally, he does extremely heavy damage without landing a single Shuriken because his death mark's damage increases from auto-attacks and spells.  If it increased only from spells, but by a greater amount, then his damage would be proper.  By adding the requirement of landing a skillshot to do high burst damage, Zed's counter-play becomes more clear rather than the previous "lol build QSS against an ad champion".

Basically, I think he'd be more fair if he relied on his W more to bully (which they are doing) and if he relied on his Q for burst.  Otherwise, I have no gripes with him.  Perhaps he is a bit too safe early, but fixing his damage against minions won't change his gameplay patterns much.

sure it would, it would force him to use abilities on minions like every other champion when farming under tower. he would have to choose poke or farm like everyone else.

zed has the easiest time under tower as he is the only champion who can let a tower hit a caster minion once, auto once, and get the cs.

That only works if the person who gets ulted doesn't understand how Zed works. I've dodged many a shuriken (back when he got through ban phase (and when I wasn't practicing the new Cass, shut up)) by walking forward instead of continuing to run away when he ulted me.

the same thing can be said about vel koz, run into vel koz and he simply cant turn fast enough  with his laser anymore. (geometry OP) 

the difference being zed is a melee champion and any caster who wants to get up close and personal and trade autos with him must be a genius.

but you'll still be hit by his spin and consequently slowed. and autoed to death.
Zed appears behind you remember? Ofc I'm not walking into him.
By definition, you are running into him, because _running away implies you'll be running in any direction besides the shadow_, which of course leaves you vulnerable to Shadow Slash.
